required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the GORE® VIABAHN® Endoprosthesis for the Treatment of Popliteal Artery Aneurysm (PAA)
clinical_study.official_title: Post-market Study: Evaluation of the GORE® VIABAHN® Endoprosthesis for the Treatment of Popliteal Artery Aneurysm

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the long term safety and performance of the GORE® VIABAHN® Endoprosthesis for the treatment of patients with Popliteal Artery Aneurysms.

primary_outcome.description: Primary Patency is defined as blood flow without occlusion maintained through the device after implant without an intervention.
Serious adverse events and adverse events related to the study procedure or the study device

intervention.description: Treatment of Popliteal Artery Aneurysm with the GORE® VIABAHN® Endoprosthesis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a symptomatic aneurysm or asymptomatic aneurysm (≥ 2 cm diameter) of the popliteal artery, or presence of mural thrombus (< 2 cm) in the popliteal artery treated since the date of reimbursement in France.
